com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dto

Enum ScmRepositoryPermission

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ScmRepositoryPermission>
      • com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dto.ScmRepositoryPermission
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityPermission<ScmRepositoryDto>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ScmRepositoryPermission>

    public enum ScmRepositoryPermission
extends java.lang.Enum<ScmRepositoryPermission>
implements EntityPermission<ScmRepositoryDto>
    These are the permissions defined for ScmRepositoryDto
    Since:
    CB-6.2

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      scm_repository_admin
      Controls if user administers the associated repository.
      scm_repository_browse
      Allows users to browse the content of this repository.
      scm_repository_changeset_attachment_add
      Permission to add attachments to change sets in a repository
      scm_repository_changeset_attachment_edit
      Permission to edit/delete any change set comments or attachments in a repository
      scm_repository_changeset_attachment_edit_own
      Permission to edit/delete own change set comments or attachments in a repository
      scm_repository_changeset_attachment_view
      Permission to view change sets comments or attachments in a repository
      scm_repository_changeset_comment_add
      Permission to add comments to change sets in a repository
      scm_repository_changeset_history_view
      Permission to view the change history of change sets in the repository
      scm_repository_changeset_subscribe
      Permission to subscribe notifications on a single change set
      scm_repository_changeset_subscribe_others
      Permission to manage subscriptions of other users for notifications on a single change set
      scm_repository_clone
      Controls if the user can view the content of the repository, get/view/download the content of source files, can checkout/clone the content of repository to a remote box (via http/ssh/apache/svn whatever ways...)
      scm_repository_close_changeset 
      scm_repository_create_remote_branch
      Controls if the user can create a new remote branch of a DVCS repository.
      scm_repository_delete_changeset
      Controls if the user can manually delete commit/push information
      scm_repository_escalation_view
      Permission to view change set escalation schedules in a repository (currently not supported)
      scm_repository_fork
      Controls if the user can create a new fork of a repository.
      scm_repository_mass_edit_changeset
      Controls if the user can edit multiple commit/push information at once.
      scm_repository_push
      Controls if an user can commit and/or push up source code changes to the repository
      scm_repository_subscribe
      Permission to subscribe notifications on the whole repository
      scm_repository_subscribe_others
      Permission to manage subscriptions of other users for notifications on the whole repository
      scm_repository_subscribers_view
      Permission to view subscriptions of other users for notifications on the whole repository
      scm_repository_update_changeset
      Controls if the user can edit commit/push information: the commit text or can re-associate a commit to a different issue.
      scm_repository_update_changeset_own
      Controls if the user can edit own commit/push information: the commit text or can re-associate a commit to a different issue.
      scm_repository_view_changeset
      Controls if the user can see commit/push information

      • scm_repository_fork

        public static final ScmRepositoryPermission scm_repository_fork
        Controls if the user can create a new fork of a repository. Used for fine-grained control of creation of repositories: the users with this permission only won't be able to create top-level repositories, but will be able to create fork of a selected repository.

      • scm_repository_create_remote_branch

        public static final ScmRepositoryPermission scm_repository_create_remote_branch
        Controls if the user can create a new remote branch of a DVCS repository.
        Since:
        CB-5.8

      • scm_repository_admin

        public static final ScmRepositoryPermission scm_repository_admin
        Controls if user administers the associated repository. The user can UPDATE,READ,DELETE the repository. The owner (who created the repo) ALWAYS gets this permission, and can never be revoked from the owner.

      • checkDependencies

        public static int checkDependencies(int bitmask)
        Check dependendies between tracker/item permissions. Unset/Clear those permissions that depend on other permissions which are not set
        Parameters:
        bitmask - to check
        Returns:
        the checked bitmask with cleared dependendies
